name: Geet's Handy Links and Notes
body:
## Docker

* Nice flow to get a scalable Spark+HDFS workbench using Docker.  Could work nicely with Swarm.  https://www.big-data-europe.eu/scalable-sparkhdfs-workbench-using-docker/.  Associated Github page: https://github.com/big-data-europe/docker-hadoop-spark-workbench
* Nice flow for JupyterHub + Swarm.   Could connect nicely with the Spark + HDFS above. https://developer.rackspace.com/blog/deploying-jupyterhub-for-education/.  Associated Github page: https://github.com/compmodels/
* Handy stacks: https://github.com/jupyter/docker-stacks

## YAML

* **Ordered YAML** This is an evolving Gist combining a few techniques online for reading and writing YAML in Python in an ordered way: https://gist.github.com/geetduggal/9f6380d4ca33e380578df50134f14751

## Programming Languages

* Some of my experimentation using the Nim language: https://github.com/geetduggal/nim-stash, https://geetduggal.wordpress.com/2014/03/03/consider-nimrod/
* Some of my experimentation with Scala: http://growcode.net/, http://www.cs.cmu.edu/~ckingsf/software/starfish/

## Some handy tools/scripts (uncategorized)

* https://github.com/s3fs-fuse/s3fs-fuse
* evolving bashrc: https://gist.github.com/geetduggal/830cda2cf406601833fce50dacbf54a5
* evolving vimrc: https://gist.github.com/geetduggal/d9702695b96b13532a291d74f7a38e38

## Newer or experimental programming languages to occasionally play with

* Scala
* Rust
* Swift
* Nim

## Favorite coding environments/tools

* Vim in a terminal: tried, true, and I always come back to it unless I need something more sophisticated
* git CLI
* iTerm2: best terminal for Mac OS
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
